I also thought about making it plug-in
for example: 
1. the GlobalIdGenerator add a function Supplier method to To expose the algorithm implementation
2. a plugin service to implement boot service to invoke the GlobalIdGenerator Supplier method

but the thinking cannot use http header as the algorithm seed

I don't think setting the global trace id is a good idea. Basically, and mostly in SkyWalking, we do auto-instrumentation, right?
The app developer is mostly impossible to set trace id before the first span created, also, it means, you can't guarantee, there is no `injection`  happened before your codes. In that case, the trace will break, the developer will be hard to understand what happened.

`GlobalIdGenerator` should be refactored as a service, which could provide the override mechanism in the plugin system. But if this is an internal service, which generation algorithm would you like to provide? And what are the benefits?

in our company , all pv coross bfe (cncf) ,and all the pv will be add  a unique bfeid as a  http header.
we want to use bfeid as a part of traceid.
I know this is a abnormal demand, I want to ensure that the company maintains the version  nearly equals the official version.
Do you have any other suggestions? thanks for your helping.
I thought about it again, this thing is not suitable for appearing in the official version,If the set method is added, basically no one else will use it in official plugin

javadoc error is not easy to locate, too much disturbing warn information.   
Local build command:   `./mvnw package javadoc:javadoc -Pagent,dist -DskipTests=true`
No Django plugin, read #4744. Please don't submit duplicated issue.

I have a feeling, you treat trace context in an easier way, which is not correct.

No matter what in the header(in HTTP only), we should not use it as a trace, because this could be an abusion. If you want to add something into the trace, from BFE perspective or others', you could follow SkyWalking `Cross Process Propagation Headers Protocol v3`, in doc https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/protocols/README.md

You could notice, the Nginx LUA agent has a different trace id format.

I think the correct solution is, making BFE follows SkyWalking protocol, including
1. Trace report
1. Cross Process Propagation Headers Protocol

WDYT?
I know your feeling,thanks for your helping
Look forward you could make BFE supported SkyWalking.
